column4: I guess the fact that this HD is ntfs isn't helping anything either :|
you realized you'll only be able to read from it right?
any ideas though? it automounted no problem when I was using breezy but it won't work in dapper :|
is the device listed in /etc/fstab
yeah it is
Same params as my sda which mounts perfectly
you add user, to the options columb
the columns are listed at the top of the file, but its the section with defaults,nls=...
Ok, now just log off and back on
umount and remount
I think you should just be able to click on the icon now
I get this now - You do not have the permissions necessary to view the contents of "externalhd".
add umask=0000 to the options
Done, still the same  - You do not have the permissions necessary to view the contents of "externalhd".
umount then clck on it
just 'umount /mount/point'
'mount /media/sdb1 && ls -ld /media/*' what are the permissions on sdb1
I just got it working man
what did you do?
ah
should
